subject: Economics
title: Gary Becker: Economics of Everything
description: A quick, practical guide to Gary Becker: Economics of Everything.

hook.text: Becker used economics to analyze crime, marriage, drug addiction, and discrimination. Economists were horrified.

buildup.text: His insight: rational choice theory applies everywhere. Criminals weigh costs vs. benefits.

discovery.text: Becker's economics of discrimination showed that prejudice is costly.

twist.text: His 'rotten kid theorem' proves even a selfish child will act generously if the family head redistributes income.

climax.text: Becker expanded economics from a study of markets to a study of all human behavior.

punchline.text: Economics isn't about money. It's about how humans make decisions.

quiz.question: How did Becker expand the scope of economics?
options: He focused only on financial markets
He applied rational choice analysis to non-market behavior like crime, marriage, and discrimination
